attributes.action: Review IVF Treatment for same sex couples in NHS England
attributes.additional_details: In England, in a same sex relationship you need to have 6 failed cycles of IVF/IUI before getting one funded attempt on the NHS. In a heterosexual relationship, you get an attempt for free if you meet certain criteria. In Wales, ALL females regardless of sexuality get 2 attempts on the NHS. In Scotland, ALL females get 3 free attempts on the NHS. In Northern Ireland, ALL females get 1 attempt. It’s about time England caught up and offered same sex females equal rights.
attributes.background: I didn’t choose to be gay, but because I am, we have to pay up to £6,000 per IVF cycle and around £2000 for embryo transfers, not including donor sperm and drugs. The fertility process isn’t an easy one and often results in same sex couples not having children because of the financial implications.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: 

Commission a review of fertility treatment for same-sex/LGBTQ+ couples:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589399
